abstract: Hydraulic fracturing in Cooperstown, NY, has pitted neighbor against neighbor; debate over so-called fracking--injecting huge quantities of chemically treated water underground to free up natural gas--has become increasingly contentious across the Eastern United States, with dozens of communities passing or considering bans; debate takes its most intimate form in small towns and rural areas like Cooperstown, where fracking has become the defining, non-negotiable political issue.
snippet: Hydraulic fracturing in the home of baseball’s Hall of Fame has pitted neighbor against neighbor.
lead_paragraph: Hydraulic fracturing in the home of baseball’s Hall of Fame has pitted neighbor against neighbor.

headline.main: Drilling Debate in Cooperstown, N.Y., Is Personal
headline.print_headline: A New York Village’s Debate Over Drilling Turns Personal
headline.seo: In Village’s Fight Over Gas Drilling, Civility Is Fading
